topic.title: Recovering Ceph Nodes After a Reboot

section.p: If you have one or more Ceph nodes that have been rebooted, these steps will assist you in the recovery.

section.title: Recovering Ceph Nodes After a Reboot

ol.li: From the lifecycle manager, once the Ceph monitor node comes up, give it a minute and then execute the following playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-status.yml --limit <monitor-hostname>
If the playbook executes successfully, repeat the steps above for each Ceph monitor node that was rebooted.

Once all the Ceph monitor nodes have been rebooted and are confirmed to be up then you need to execute the command below on each monitor node: ceph quorum_status
Ensure that all of the monitor nodes have joined the quorum by observing that in the output the quorum_names section lists all of the monitors in the Ceph cluster.
Next, reboot the OSD node in the cluster.

Once the OSD node comes up, wait around five minutes and then execute the following playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-status.yml --limit <OSD-hostname>
If the playbook executes successfully, repeat steps 5-6 for each OSD node in the cluster.
Once the entire cluster is rebooted then execute the command below and observe that it is HEALTH_OK: ceph health details
